BETS and RISELab:

Main project is the XBOS-DR project led by Therese Pfeffer under the mentorship of Aris Athansios Panagopoulus. The BETS team is advised by David Culler Dean of Data Science. Published a paper and poster. Leading developments on control system. Using Machine Learning techniques to develop predictive models in conjunction with optimization programs. Evaluating various optimization algorithms. High impact and mobility in project. Recommendations for what's going on. Taking Initiative and being a point of contact.


Justin McCrary

Worked under the supervision of Justin McCrary (https://eml.berkeley.edu/~jmccrary/). Data analysis for the paper How Rigged Are Stock Markets?: Evidence From Microsecond Timestamps (https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=2812123) where more data was analyzed to support results found in paper. Gained deep knowledge of markets, market tools and arbitrage techniques. Latency arbitrage conducted by High Frequency Arbitrage was the main focus.


Creating displays

Worked under supervision of Brian Barsky https://www2.eecs.berkeley.edu/Faculty/Homepages/barsky.html on evaluating various simulation methods for deciding the types of display to use for phones. Such displays should allow users with eye deficiencies to read without glasses. My work focused on creating an accurate methodology for the simulation and evaluating existing simulations.
